content:
Our team Revo (Takeoka, Akimoto, Hayashi, and Oyamada) won AIO 3rd, a Japanese Quiz AI competition (2022/09 - 2022/12). The goal of the competition is to find optimal answers for given quizzes without any context accurately. Revo has achieved 93.8% accuracy on the test set.

title: 1st place on AIO3rd

content:
Our team Revo (Akimoto & Takeoka) won AIO 2nd, a Japanese Quiz AI competition (2021/10 - 2022/03). The goal of the competition is to find optimal answers for given quizzes without any context accurately. Revo has achieved 83.9% accuracy on the test set.

title: 1st place on AIO2nd

content: Yotta Free is a Mac app for making users look drunk. Using both this app and a video conferencing app, you can enjoy online drinking parties without alcohol. Yotta Free changes your face and voice to look drunk in real-time. This app is used face segmentation face-parsing.Pytorch and vocoder PyWorld inside. This app is developed with my friends in a one-day hackathon HackDay 2021.
summary: Yotta Free is a Mac app for making users look drunk.
title: Yotta Free

summary: We propose a novel alogrithm for utilizing *unsure* labels for instances from annotators to find optimal parameters quickly.
title: Learning with Unsure Responses

content: Insticker is a system for instantly generating a sticker from a target word and your emotion. This system works with a laptop PC and a cutting plotter. Insticker project is in a one-day hackathon HackDay 2019.
summary: a system for instantly generating a sticker from a target word and your emotion
title: Insticker
Meimei: An Efficient Probabilistic Approach for Semantically Annotating Tables

content:
HELLO WORLD! is a web application for pair programming and video meeting. Pair programming is often used in education for programming, however, it is difficult to find a good teacher in your neighborhood. HELLO WORLD! helps them to do pair programming online.
Features:
 Edit codes at the same time Chat in video communication Run codes in a browser  This project is joint work with my friends in a hackathon JPHacks 2016. This is an overview of the project and its detail is here in Japanese.
summary: a web app for online pair programming and video communication
title: HELLO WORLD!
